text: All men by nature desire knowledge.
author: Aristotle

text: Heights by great men reached and kept were not obtained by sudden flight but, while their companions slept, they were toiling upward in the night.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: The TV business is uglier than most things. It is normally perceived as some kind of cruel and shallow money trench through the heart of the journalism industry, a long plastic hallway where thieves and pimps run free and good men die like dogs, for no good reason.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

text: When men and woman die, as poets sung, his heart's the last part moves, her last, the tongue.
author: Benjamin Franklin
